<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 276, 348, 293]]<|/det|>
## ADDITIONAL MATHEMATICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 155, 316]]<|/det|>
Paper 2  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[707, 301, 905, 316]]<|/det|>
October/November 2023  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|>
2 hours  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 370]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the question paper.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 359, 400]]<|/det|>
No additional materials are needed.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 228, 434]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 880, 604]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 219, 649]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 730, 682]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 80.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[398, 73, 599, 89]]<|/det|>
Mathematical Formulae  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[437, 133, 561, 151]]<|/det|>
## 1. ALGEBRA  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 165, 240, 182]]<|/det|>
Quadratic Equation  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 194, 384, 212]]<|/det|>
For the equation \(ax^{2} + bx + c = 0\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 212, 581, 248]]<|/det|>
\[x = \frac{-b\pm\sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 271, 228, 288]]<|/det|>
Binomial Theorem  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 291, 752, 330]]<|/det|>
\[(a + b)^{n} = a^{n} + \binom{n}{1} a^{n - 1}b + \binom{n}{2} a^{n - 2}b^{2} + \ldots +\binom{n}{r} a^{n - r}b^{r} + \ldots +b^{n}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 344, 499, 380]]<|/det|>
where \(n\) is a positive integer and \(\binom{n}{r} = \frac{n!}{(n - r)!r!}\)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 409, 384, 427]]<|/det|>
Arithmetic series \(u_{n} = a + (n - 1)d\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 432, 534, 464]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{1}{2} n(a + l) = \frac{1}{2} n\left\{2a + (n - 1)d\right\}\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 486, 336, 504]]<|/det|>
Geometric series \(u_{n} = ar^{n - 1}\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 508, 428, 579]]<|/det|>
\[S_{n} = \frac{a(1 - r^{n})}{1 - r} (r\neq 1)\] \[S_{\infty} = \frac{a}{1 - r} (|r|< 1)\]  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[401, 610, 594, 628]]<|/det|>
## 2. TRIGONOMETRY  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 643, 156, 660]]<|/det|>
Identities  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[415, 670, 583, 721]]<|/det|>
\[\sin^{2}A + \cos^{2}A = 1\] \[\sec^{2}A = 1 + \tan^{2}A\] \[\csc \mathrm{e}^{2}A = 1 + \cot^{2}A\]  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 765, 242, 782]]<|/det|>
Formulae for \(\Delta ABC\)  

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[405, 791, 594, 880]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{a}{\sin A} = \frac{b}{\sin B} = \frac{c}{\sin C\] \[a^{2} = b^{2} + c^{2} - 2bc\cos A\] \[\Delta = \frac{1}{2} bc\sin A\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 97, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 71, 646, 90]]<|/det|>
The functions f and g are defined as follows, for all real values of \(x\).

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 102, 529, 121]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{f}(x) = 2\sin x + 3\cos x\]

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 133, 465, 152]]<|/det|>
\[\mathrm{g}(x) = \mathrm{e}^{3x} - 1\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 164, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 245, 183]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{fg}(0)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 183]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 320, 146, 338]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 320, 245, 338]]<|/det|>
Find \(\mathrm{gg}(x)\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 320, 920, 338]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 473, 143, 491]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 472, 442, 492]]<|/det|>
Solve the equation \(\mathrm{g}^{-1}(x) = \frac{1}{3}\ln 5.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 473, 920, 491]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 97, 94]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 920, 97]]<|/det|>
Find the values of \(k\) for which the curve \(y = x^{2} + kx + (4k - 15)\) is completely above the \(x\)-axis. [4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 73, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 683, 92]]<|/det|>
The curved surface area of a cylinder with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(2\pi rh\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 557, 123]]<|/det|>
A closed cylinder has radius \(r\mathrm{cm}\) and volume \(1000\mathrm{cm}^3\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 134, 144, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 131, 695, 153]]<|/det|>
Show that the total surface area of the cylinder is \(2\pi r^2 + \frac{2000}{r}\mathrm{cm}^2\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 131, 920, 151]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 444, 146, 463]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 444, 920, 477]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(r\) which makes this area a minimum. You should show that your value of \(r\) gives a minimum for this area.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 460, 920, 479]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 72, 92, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A particle travels in a straight line. Its displacement, \(s\) metres, from the origin, at time \(t\) seconds, where \(t > 2\), is given by \(s = \ln (4t^2 - 5) - t\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 116, 144, 134]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 116, 798, 136]]<|/det|>
Find expressions for the velocity, \(v \mathrm{ms}^{- 1}\), and acceleration, \(a \mathrm{ms}^{- 2}\), of the particle.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 117, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 350, 146, 368]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 350, 475, 368]]<|/det|>
Find the time when the particle is at rest.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 350, 920, 368]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 737, 144, 756]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 737, 418, 756]]<|/det|>
Find the acceleration at this time.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 737, 920, 756]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 72, 97, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>7</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 71, 586, 91]]<|/det|>
**DO NOT USE A CALCULATOR IN THIS QUESTION.**

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 98, 887, 292]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 312, 144, 333]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 311, 751, 343]]<|/det|>
Given that the area of triangle \(ABC\) is \(\frac{3 + \sqrt{3}}{4}\), show that \(\sin 75^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{6} + \sqrt{2}}{4}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[888, 323, 920, 342]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 630, 146, 648]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 630, 428, 648]]<|/det|>
Hence find the exact length of \(AC\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 630, 920, 648]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 81, 97, 101]]<|/det|>
<label>8</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 146, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 78, 240, 100]]<|/det|>
Show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[245, 72, 539, 109]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\sin x}{\tan x - 1} -\frac{\cos x}{\tan x + 1} = \frac{\cos x}{\sin^2 x - \cos^2 x}.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 81, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 146, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 75, 710, 104]]<|/det|>
Hence solve the equation \(\frac{\sin x}{\tan x - 1} - \frac{\cos x}{\tan x + 1} = 1\) for \(0^{\circ}< x< 360^{\circ}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 78, 920, 97]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>9</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 75, 371, 94]]<|/det|>
A curve has equation \(y = x\mathrm{e}^{2x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 104, 144, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 102, 230, 123]]<|/det|>
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 106, 918, 125]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 308, 146, 327]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 308, 574, 327]]<|/det|>
Find the equation of the normal to the curve at \(x = 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 308, 918, 327]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 81, 144, 100]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 76, 685, 102]]<|/det|>
Use your answer to part (a) to find the exact value of \(\int_{0}^{2} 2x\mathrm{e}^{2x}\mathrm{d}x.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 106, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>10</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 71, 843, 106]]<|/det|>
In an arithmetic progression the 5th term is 11. The 7th term is three times the 2nd term. Find the 1st term and the common difference.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 84, 920, 103]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 920, 106]]<|/det|>
A different arithmetic progression (AP) and a geometric progression (GP) have the following properties.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 117, 529, 135]]<|/det|>
· The 1st terms of the AP and GP are both 3.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 133, 672, 151]]<|/det|>
· The 2nd term of the AP is the same as the 3rd term of the GP.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 149, 667, 167]]<|/det|>
· The 6th term of the AP is the same as the 5th term of the GP.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 164, 554, 183]]<|/det|>
· The common ratio of the GP is greater than 1.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 195, 712, 213]]<|/det|>
Find the common difference of the AP and the common ratio of the GP.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 196, 920, 214]]<|/det|>
<mark>[6]
